comment.body: Per your user description: I don't know who you are, and only you can decide that for yourself.
TIL I can follow myself. Interesting!
The square heart is a like, I think. At least, that's what it comes up as in the activity feed.
Also comments will appear in chronological order with the newest at the top, so you don't have to scroll for a couple years to find the latest in a long thread.
This for sure. I don't check my activity feed very often, and I never know anything happens when I'm out browsing other people's pages.
What markdown does ZeroMe use anyway? Does anyone know?

Might want to note @Nofish: The like function seems buggy. When I like a post, the counter increments up properly, but refreshing or coming back to the page later makes the icon return to a grey color, thus no longer indicating whether I've liked the post or not. (The number remains the same.)

Yay, my bug got fixed! 

Would it be possible to add support so you get an activity feed notification whenever your name is @mentioned? I know it's a lot to ask in a short period of time, but it's a good feature that really should exist in any good social media platform. (If it already exists and I just haven't seen it yet, disregard this message.)

Edit: Also perhaps add posts to the activity feed in addition to comments? I'd like to know when someone makes a post.
Ah, ok. To Github it is, then.
